Being able to monitor and control the temperature in your house, office, or other property at any time from anywhere in the world is simply incredible.

This app works very well and was easy to set up. I like the way it was done with a temporary ad-hoc WiFi network prior to having Internet access. The app had some bugs in the older releases, but they have done an amazing job of adding features and making it more stable since then. One of the biggest improvements is the ability to review and configure the automatic schedule. They have kept up with regular updates and bug fixes ever since this product and app were released. title: Superb
text:

Frankly, the app at that point sucked, and the scathing reviews were justified. 

But the developers listened to the complaints, and made significant improvements. Not only did they add back the features omitted from the original app, but they added the ability to program the weekly schedule from within the app. Before this change, you could only program the schedule using a Web browser and a clunky HTML interface. The app's scheduling interface is amazingly elegant and easy to use.

title: Great App. Great Product.
text:
Consider this product over Nest. Four years ago I bought this thermostat because it was the most affordable wifi one on the market. Four years later and it still holds up. Recently and almost too quietly they added "radius," a geofence the automatically puts your home in away mode when you leave your self determined distance from your home. This is a fantastic addition to a device I bought to long ago. 

Nest recently purchased another product of mine, Revolv, and discontinued it. No money back. No alternative. No response from them at all. They truly don't care about their customers.

Radio Thermostat has been there from the beginning. Makes improvements and have great customer support. You won't be sorry.

title: Saved me money!!!
text:
I just got my 3M50 WiFI thermostat at Home Depot!  

My husband and I just left town for the weekend, and we realized that we didn't turn off the heat.  As we were driving down the highway, I was able to put my thermostat in the away mode so the heat didn't turn on.  As we got close to home, we just slid the temperature up and everythign was nice and cozy when we got home.

I'm sure this invesment will pay for itself by the end of the winter.  Doing some rough math - my heating bills in the winter are around $300 - that works out to roughly $10/day.  All I have to do is use my iPhone to keep my heat off when I'm not home.  Nothing is worse than leaving the house and forgetting to set that thermostat back - what a waste of money - now I can take my thermostat with me!

title: Better than unreliable/overpriced Nest
text:
I appreciate how the developer is consistently upgrading this app, both visual and under hood improvements. I also love how the iPhone can now communicate directly with thermostat while on local wifi with zero delay.  This app and associated thermostat have worked perfectly for me for 3 years.  If needed, I'd replace with exact model.  Don't waste your money on Nest.  Read the horror story reviews.  

Update:  It has been 4 years and has allowed me to remotely connect every single time.  I now have z-wave home automation in my home but don't plan on switching to a z-wave thermostat because I no there is no way it will be as RELIABLE.  An app and thermostat like this only work if you can rely on it like this one.  Keep up the improvements and upgrades to stay ahead of the pack.

Update:

Love the new runtime graphs!  This easily lets me see how adjusting the set point changes runtime.  I can now say for sure that if you lower the temperature during the day while you're at work that you save lots of money.  Very well implemented.  This is the coolest app on my iPhone.  If you get a wifi thermostat I highly suggest one that works through this app.

title: Bad redesign
text: Like many other reviewers I'm disappointed that the app doesn't look like a thermostat interface anymore.  Not only do I not understand why I have to go to a different screen to change the temperature, but I also don't understand why I have to click okay when I'm done.  On the old version my thermostat would respond in less than five seconds. Now on this version, it takes about 10 minutes for the thermostat to respond to my temperature change.  While I appreciate the ability to change the temperature from anywhere in the world, I would expect my thermostat to respond quicker when I'm in the house.  The up button on my thermostat doesn't work very well but I guess I'm going to have to start using it if I want to change the temperature in my house.

title: Works well but needs new features
text:
Have had 2 Radiothermostats for 4 years and after getting over some earlier issues this app makes programming the thermostat easy. When Radius was added it made it even better however things have moved on now and new features need to get added. 

- IFTTT please add support for this, if my thermostat senses I am away I'd like to trigger other things to happen at the house.
- The Runtime graph is great and outdoor temp is nice to see please put them on the same graph. 
- Figure out the time to get to temperature, if I want it at 69 degrees by the time I get home turn it on earlier!  You have the data recorded over at least the last few months.  Indoor temp, outdoor temp and how long it took to get to the desired indoor temp previously, shouldn't be too hard to work out.

title: Works great with a few caveats
text: I love being able to control my thermostat this way. Our thermostat is located in a hard to access area and this has been fantastic. A few little annoyances however - I have to force quit the app from the multitasked fairly often to get it to properly talk to my thermostat. It will look like it's working fine but the thermostat doesn't respond. As soon as I force quit and restart the app it works fine. I'd also love to have an auto setting so that it maintains the proper temperature without me having to switch it between heat and cool. The only other thing I'd like to see is the ability to program the thermostat. I can do it from my computer but it would be much more convenient to use my iPhone.

title: Good update
text:
Much better update! The app is now laid out well and seems to work faster and better with my three thermostats. Fewer taps to see the temp and target, easier to adjust. Love the new note about when the temp is going to change next - I'm always forgetting how my schedules are set up. Thanks for the update!

Previous update:
The previous version was ugly and worked only landscape, but it was more functional and easier to use. I used to be able to see at a glance what my three thermostats were set at. Now I have to bounce back and forth between different screens. Very annoying. When not on the same network there seems to be a long delay and the thermostat is not set to the same thing I'm seeing in the app. Very disappointing, I wish I hadn't updated.

title: App works great!
text:
I've used my city's Honeywell tstat that allowed a one-way online control feature (could change the temp only) and this unit/app is by far the better choice.  The app shows the current temp, unlike my power company's unit. No, you cannot create or edit the tstat's program, but that can be done easily on the unit or through their website.

Maybe I'm more mechanically inclined than the average reviewer, but I found the unit extremely easy to install and setup based on the simple instructions.  Maybe they have old units or trouble beyond the thermostat? I'm really giving this app a 4.5 out of 5, taking half a star off for lack of direct programming capability. That can be easily added I assume.

title: A great product
text:
Just updating this two-year-old review to say that this product is still working perfectly for me.  This thing is great.

-----------------

I have has this thing for several years now.  There were a lot of problems early on.  But that has all been solved.  This is now a very reliable product.  And what a pleasure it is to have in one's life.  To be able to have an odd schedule as I do and yet be able to come home to a warm house.  

The ability to see and set your schedule via a website or an app is great.  This is so different than most "set back" thermostats wherein you must set your schedule using a tiny display and a few buttons.  You will use this setback schedule feature because it is usable.

The latest update adds a feature that lets you see a graph of temperatures in your house and furnace runtime.  This is very helpful to you and really shows you how your settings and how the weather affects your energy use and cost.  

The user interface is easy to use.

This is a 95% of the function of nest for about 40% of the price.

title: Overdone Security 2
text: I love this thermostat but I hate it when the app accidentally "forgets" my password. Now, the new version will "forget" me on purpose and make me re-enter my login credentials every 2 months???  I agree with the earlier reviewer who said this is a thermostat app and not a banking app and this is overkill. I already use a PW on my phone itself and use a unique and secure PW for each of my apps so it is a pain to lookup the login credentials for my thermostat every time it "forgets". This is multiplied since I have the app installed on 4 different devices. For the first time, this is one update I won't be installing until this unwanted "feature" is removed.  Or how about adding a preference where the user selects how often the PW needs to be re-entered with options of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly or never...

title: I love the functionality
text:
I've been using a wifi thermostat for a couple years now, and these apps since the previous company ran it.  This summer we spent a week or so in the upper 90's and 100's, very unusual for this area.  I love being able to use my phone from anywhere and adjust the settings.  VERY handy when I'd end up leaving work early and going home before the schedule would have kicked in the AC.  I just set it for what I wanted before I left so it would already be cooling off by the time I got home.

They do a nice job of improving the app as well, adding functionality and tweaking issues - and for free, what more can you ask?

title: Not Bad 4 Free
text:
Should really not be 4-Star (3?) but it is a free app, so 4-Stars. 
Works well. Can adjust your thermostat from anywhere. You cannot change the daily programming. You have to do that from the touchscreen on the tstat. 
Has crashed a few times and I have to restart app to get it to work - but several apps I use do that (could be my iPhone). 
Also - when initializing the app to your tstat it was not clear that you need to turn off your cellular data (in iPhone settings) to restrict the WiFi to tstat network. That probably doesn't make sense until you use the app the first time. 
Bottom line - Not too bad. Has a real need to be updated with additional features and ease of initialization of the app.

title: Much Better than expected (2installed now)
text:
I realize the reviews here are meant for just the software, however without the hardware, it would be meaningless.
5weeks ago I installed (and setup) the first 3M50 WiFi Thermostat, every step of the install and wifi setup went exactly as expected. Functionality was also flawless from the moment it went live, and I found a good deal on a second one for the rest of the house, and installed it just a few days ago. Once again, install & setup were flawless, and for the few days that both have been live together, they have performed flawlessly. Fantastic Stuff!!!

title: Works great
text:
After over a month online I have had no problems at all. It's great and both my wife & I enjoy it. 

Only thing I would like is the ability to do a temporary change, for 2 hours, and have it automatically revert to its program setting. 
If you gave that ability, please allow us to choose when we would want to do it.
Some days I retire after the last daily change and would like to temporally make a 2 hour change. 

Easy install of both thermostat and IPhone App. I used the online software to program my schedule when I first installed the 3M50 thermostat. It was faster then trying to stand there and do it.
This App works with zero problems encountered thus far. 
I installed this app on both my phone and my wife's. She likes how easy it is for her. She has a very hard time walking due to bad knees and this was perfect. 
Some people have commented that they would like to schedule thru this app. I would recommend they just use their laptop. 
Would be nice to see outside air temp.

title: Nice
text:
I disagree with all the negative comments.  The interface is a nice step forward, changing temp is as simple as tapping the target temp and adjusting.  I have had no problems with temps changing on its own, perhaps people should adjust their schedule times,  if you want to change temps and not have them change back on there own make sure to HOLD the temp you adjust to, otherwise any change you make is just temporary until the next scheduled time slot.  

I do, however, wish that it still showed half degrees like the old version, instead of rounding up to the nearest degree.

title: works Great, Like new features
text:
Other features wanted, more settings per day than four available, I could save a bunch more $$$, kids get up at 4 am for collage and leave by 5am, then one at 7 am, then us at 9am, everyone leaves by 10, so lots of up and downs would conserve more energy. 
 Do all my programming on my phone, it's so easy, Love that ! (just want more per day)
  Is their a way to plug  a average heat cost to the chart to show a Dollar amount it cost you to run energy cost per day/week/month would be nice 
  Also a link to instruction manual online 
 Very happy with this thermostat and app that keeps improving !

title: Nice App, but one major shortcoming
text:
The app works very well once you figure out the thermostat only phones home to the company's servers about once every five minutes.   So if you're away from your home wireless on a regular internet connection expect a lag between a setting change and when your thermostat actually changes settings. No big deal really, just something to be aware of. 

Major shortcoming of this app is the fact that you can't set the heating/cooling schedule with it. You have to login with a standard browser on a computer in order to edit it.  Hopefully they'll update the app to include this functionality soon.

title: It's a remote control for the radio thermostat
text: This app is designed to control a relatively inexpensive radio thermostat. It does exactly what it supposed to and I think a little bit more. Since I always have my phone by me I use the app instead of the thermostat to make adjustments. Hot in the middle of the night? Just grab the phone and cool things down. It's very handy. Could it be better? Sure.  Like others have mentioned it would be nice to program the thermostat from the phone but really it don't do that very often so I don't understand why people are downgrading the program. I think it works great.

title: I Love This App!
text:
I have experienced the connection issues described by some users here but those all went away by changing the security on my wireless router to WAP2 from WAP. When I was on WAP there were many connection and other issues that made the app basically unusable. After switching to WAP2 I've had no problems and the app works great. When it does work I LOVE IT.  

I'd like to see some more features though. How about using the iPhone GPS feature to turn down the heat the farther I get away from home and turn it up as I get closer?  This app has a lot of potential that has not been reached yet. Overall, for a free app on a $99 thermostat I think it rocks.

title: Works 1/2 the time
text: I've had this for a year now. I wish I would've waited so I could have put the money towards a nest. This app honestly only works half the time. I used to show it off and now I just don't want to embarrass myself by the never ending link in progress pic and eventual error message. Everytime I open it I wonder, will it work this time. I bought a Mac because I was sick of the issues and slow load times and constant os reboots of windows. Now I feel like I have a windows thermostat because I'm constantly checking something or reloading, signing back in, reregistering,  or giving up in frustration. Great idea, but they should've hired some apple engineers for software and hardware. At least I got it on sale. Just seems like they made something simple very complex. Typical windows

title: Good on iPhone, bad on iPad.
text:
I think the iPhone version is fantastic. The fact is the old version tried to be a thermostat (literally) and it isn't. It's a phone, and the new ui is perfect for a phone environment.

That said, what the hell were they thinking with iPad layout?! You have a 1024x768 canvas (about to be double that too) and you stick it all into a 320x480 box. There is no reason for the app to scroll, and yet it has to because it is confined into that 320x480 box. I would be better off with an iPhone only version blown upg to full screen.

title: Hard initial setup, app rarely works
text: Installed and connected the wires to the thermostat just fine, then the problems arose.  On initial wi-fi setup, had to reload and update the firmware several times before it would connect to my wireless network.  Once it finally connected, it worked fine for a couple days.  Then noticed when trying to launch the app, it gives an error (on the iPad and iPhone).  Even after the update, and after logging out and back in, the issues still occur.  It's very shotty and I've started to notice problems with the "Program" feature on the thermostat itself.  Thought this was going to be a reasonable alternative to an Ecobee, but it comes down to "you get what you pay for".  This will be going back to Home Depot and I'm going to order an Ecobee, the real wi-fi thermostat.

title: 4 years, excellent thermostat and app!
text: I have had this app and thermostat for about 4 years. I am a technical person, so it wasn't as difficult to setup for me as others. It used to be a different app, then this new one took the place of the other. Overall, I am pleased as there is no monthly fee and I can control my thermostat from anywhere. I actually use it the most at home if I don't want to get up to adjust the thermostat. I also use it when I am headed home from a long trip to warm up or cool off the house before I get home. Very handy. Cheaper than nest too.

title: Intuitive - Comprehensive - Useful
text:
App is very straightforward to set up (although getting a thermostat connected to the local network can be tedious, it's only needed once unless changes are made to the network). After that, the app is intuitive and easy to use, whether setting a schedule for the thermostat or making one-off adjustments.  The usage data the  app provides is excellent for tracking HVAC runtime to determine if schedule modifications would help conserve power usage. 
I highly recommend this application (including its desktop companion software).

title: Great app
text:
I rarely use the programable feature on this device because my schedule never has any sort of consistency so as you can imagine using my phone to turn up or down the thermostat is amazing!

There are times when I put the change of temp. in through the app and it doesn't register my change so what I normally do is just exit the app reopen it and then make the temp. change again. This seems to work just fine. You have to make sure that the target temp. on the bottom left is showing the change you made. Once you see that then your good.

This glitch doesn't bother me because it's still new technology and it always seems to work on the next try.

Also for the Money this is a great thermostat. Other wifi enabled thermostats like the nest are way more and I don't like the idea of a thermostat learning my habits when I don't have any habits or normal consistency.

title: If it ain't broke.....
text: If it ain't broke then don't fix it.  Well it's broke again and last time the update fixed itself in a couple of hours. Now it's been going on 24 hours and nothing. No connection. Please test the app before submitting. Have three of these units on two homes. Really need it to work. Please investigate and post an update that works. This is too good of an operation and product to not work. Thanks.  Just corrected the problem by logging out on settings page and logging back in. Version still reads 1.4.0 although I downloaded latest version 1.4.2.

title: Take a second chance
text: My first one of these thermostats worked pretty well until it died. Then they change the app GUI which used to look like the actual thermostat. At one time they also made it communicate over your local LAN without the need to use their server. Not sure if it still has this capability. Anyway, I got a replacement unit but have been afraid that it will die just like the first and have to go though the hassle again. And since Home Depot no longer sells them, where do you go for a replacement when it's in warranty? Watch out for those static discharges and power voltage spikes. That what killed my Honeywell thermostat and then my 3M Filtrete thermostat.

title: Good improvement
text: On the previous version my rating was a 2/5. With this version it is a 4/5. A lot of improvement, love the full display and new features. Now it would be awesome if you can add more control to the thermostat from the app, like the ability to create a custome temp schedule right from the app for specific days. Also give customers and users the ability to change all setting you would had to change in the thermostat small screen and allow them to be able to use the iPads big screen to change all those settings. When you do that I can warranty a 5+/5!

title: awesome energy savings
text:
I love this app.  My thermostat install went very smoothly, the wiring install took me about 20 minutes.  I then set the thermostat up on my network right from this app.  It really couldn't have been any easier.  I love that I can turn on the heat on my way home from work.  I know I could program the thermostat, but I don't come home the same time everyday.  I can't bear the thought of wasting money heating my house when I'm not home.  This app and thermostat solves my problem!  Great product, great app.

Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful App!
text:
I just love this app. I can cool my apartment down from anywhere if I am going to use it within an hour or so for guests. I am away at my girlfriend's home (12 miles away) on weekends and I sometimes use my apartment for a few hours on Saturday to meet with my musician friends to play music. With this app I can cool off the apartment before we get there. 
Pros: Can set regular schedule and remotely change the temp from your smartphone. Very user friendly. 
Cons: Complicated to set up the wifi connection so must have written instructions if you haven't done so in awhile.

title: At least they fixed it.
text: So you finally fixed it huh? Only took forever and a year to bring it closer to the best version of this app which was actually the FIRST ever version. Now that it's closer to the best version it really deserves 4 stars. You guys claim that you want us to have the best thermostat experience but you're hecka slow with the updates and it still doesn't have the ability to adjust, change or add to the scheduling. Keep working towards that and then you'll have the truly best thermostat app on the AppStore. Waiting a long time to fix problems is not something That will get you the best ratings.

title: Great control over thermostat!
text:
I've had this thermostat for more than two years.  Over that time, the software has improved greatly, and I no longer have any disconnects or any other issues.  It just works. 

Initial setup can be a bit confusing for the non technical, but there are plenty of videos to provide help.  In addition, you can chat on line for help.  

I had a hardware malfunction, used the chat service, and they sent me a new part in less than a week. No charge, no questions.    This has become a great company and a great app.

title: Love it!
text:
Installed this in December.  Went on vacation and turned the heat down and back up with the app's home and away button without any problems.  Haven't experienced any of the problems that people have mentioned from SW update yet.  Will give it a trial run to be sure before next vacation.

I do find the thermostat itself a bit tricky to use and hold temps so maybe it's the thermostat that has issues for some.  The concept is brilliant!  Now I want to get the Craftsman garage door with Assurlink so I can check IT from my phone!

title: This is a must have....
text:
This thing is AWESOME and so what if you have to log into your online account once in a while instead of the app working....YOU'RE MONITORING YOUR THERMOSTAT REMOTELY FROM SPACE!!!!!!!!! Give them time to work the kinks out!!!!! This thing is awesome and I'm going to get them for all 6 zones in my house! It's the best $99 I've ever spent.....plus I can monitor the stat when my wife gets home and turns it up to 90 thinking it will get warmer faster!!! 

Tech support often requires leaving a message but they called back within an hour or two and walked me right through everything.....very helpful and they DO know what they were doing! And to spend 10 or 15 minutes on the phone to get this up and running????? PRICELESS I will save way more then the $100 in heating bills.

I have told everyone I know about this and will continue to do so.

I travel a lot during the winter and there is nothing better than coming home to a warm bedroom.

title: Great. One Suggestion.
text: I was considering buying a Honeywell Lyric for its geofencing function, and then this update came and pleasantly surprised me. So far geofencing seems to work. I would be even greater if the user can select different distance parameters for leaving and returning to a house. For example, I'd like it to set it to "away" as soon as I'm 500 feet away but end "away" when I move into a 10-mile radius. This is because it takes a considerable amount of time for steam heat to warm a house back. Right now, the geofencing activation is the same for exiting and entering a house.

title: On the right track, but...
text:
This time, the controls for changing the daily schedule have been added to the app - yes!  The method of dragging and arrow-ing the times and temps in a visual format is intuitive and smooth.  But-but-but, the app reliably CRASHES without saving the schedule changes when the "Save" button is pressed.  Rut-roh.

The user interface is great, and finally gives users the means to set a schedule without running a web UI, but the underlying mechanicals need a bit more tuning before this feature can be deemed "fully-baked".

UPDATE: Just a day later, the program has been updated to not crash. Amazing.

title: Total Control (stable infrastructure  required)
text: Used this app with a CT50 for more than a year and I'm completely satisfied. I can control my energy cost from half way around the world while away on business for months at a time and my family remains comfortable at home. Like any app or hardware a stable network, safe wi-fi, right OS for hardware Gen., healthy/non-glitchy internet connection (firewall or ISP) are ALL REQUIRED. Also, none of the aforementioned will help if you suffer from O.E. I backed off 1 star on my rating because the thermostat & connection steps are not idiot proof but that said, this system is a good value for the cost.

title: Come a long way....
text: I have had a wifi compatible thermostat for just over a year now. The setup was the biggest pain because it's not as intuitive as I hoped. When I called the service number they were very little help.... Really no help at all. The app was also very plain and glitchy. The new version of this app however is amazing. It shows how much money you will save or spend if you were to adjust the temperature. Thanks for the improvements! I like lying in bed at 3 in the morning and turning off the A/C without having to burn a calorie.

title: Simple, clean, works!
text:
I have only had my new  radio thermostats (2) and the app for a week now.  I guess I was not wedded to the former app design as apparently so many commenting are.  This update is simple, clean, and just works!  I can't ask for more myself.  Only even slightly negative thought I have is the former blue background color was nice.  On the big plus side for me is I am glad not to be forced to turn phone over into landscape mode to do something as simple as checking my thermostats!

Bottom line - new app works fore!

title: Really good software
text: I have a filtrete stat at work (this one) and a Honeywell one at home. Both wifi. While I think the hardware could be improved on to be more modern and smaller, the software is excellent. Easy to change schedule and I find I look at use history quite a bit. Has definitely saved us money over a previous stat. I much prefer this app over honeywells. Maybe a couple of ideas are an Apple Watch app and also show in the app when the HVac system is running. The Honeywell does that, otherwise very pleased!

title: New App update is better (Vers 2.2)
text:
Newest with schedule looks good but like others schedule doesn't work, App crashes when you try to save. I'm a SQA Analyst, you guys really need one because your not doing basic tests.

Getting better, not as good as the original but far better then the last version. The original version looked like the thermostat, let's see if you can try for that again instead of the poor layouts you keep doing. Also I use simple mode (no programming) yet the App keeps telling me the temperature will change based on the program I an not using. Let's try to fix it right next time and maybe it will go back to 5 stars.

title: Ultra nice way to save $$$
text:
This app is the most valuable and green thing you can do with iOS. I monitor and control the temp in my home from anywhere including my bed. Always nice and warm just as I get up and cool just before I arrive home. I will be saving a fortune on energy.

Installation including the connection of the thermostat to my wifi network was a breeze using this app. Anyone could do it. 

Do you hate trying to program your thermostat? I'm a programmer and I hate doing it. Not with this app. You never have to touch the thermostat just grab your iOS device and simply drag sliders to set multiple temperature settings and set backs for each day of the week. It's actually fun to do!

The really nice backlit, touch screen thermostats cost under $100 and I think I will save that on fuel in a few months. 

This app and the thermostats heralded the true start of a practical smart home, and all for under $100!!

title: Great update - love schedule editor
text:
It's actually easy to edit the schedule now on the app than through the web. As it should be! This is a great update. 

The only missing features now are advanced setup like temperature offset and differential that are only accessible through the wall unit. I use differential throughout the year since it allows for half of a degree of granularity whereas the temp set point is only whole degrees; that half a degree makes a bog difference as the seasons change thought the year.

I'd love to see a future update where there is effectively a full featured digital version of wall unit in the app.

title: Nice upgrade. I like the new iPad app and the ability to adjust set point on the home screen.
text:
I have to admit that I can't see what all the Luddites here are complaining about. Lets face it - the old interface that pretended to look like a thermostat, only worked in landscape mode, and had a Windows 95 look to it was kind of cheesy. This new app looks like a modern iPhone app and works like a standard iPhone app. 
It's also much faster for me at communicating with the thermostat than the old version. I suspect there must have been some backend upgrades as well. 
Thanks.

title: Great app; would like to see Apple Watch support!
text:
The geofencing/radius feature of the app is awesome. As someone who's in and out of the house frequently and unpredictably, schedules don't do me much good. However, being able to use the radius feature to automatically shut off HVAC when I'm a few miles from home (and then turn back on when I approach) is great! In general, the app is a very reliable companion to my radio thermostats.

I would really love the ability to quickly set/change temperature settings from my Apple Watch, though. Hopefully the devs will consider this for a future update.

title: Amazing
text:
I have wanted a Nest for a while. They are pretty expensive. I tried a lower end WiFi Honeywell thermostat. It was okay, but didn't offer any cool features. Compelling features for me is local wifi operation (when home), the API and Radius. 

This thermostat was easy to setup. It has physical switches to pick between air conditioning types. The app setup was super easy and walked me through everything. The schedule interface is amazing. The only thing that would make me rate it a 6 star (if that were possible) is if it could support HomeKit in the future.

title: Works very well
text:
My home has several zones controlled by louvres in the ducts. Each zone has a thermostat, and I adjust them based on how they are used.  Whenever I need to override the schedule for a guest or party this app lets me do so quickly without running all over the house.  
As a side note, the web site can provide you detailed information on runtime - the times and durations it ran in a graph that really helps understand where your money is going.  Lastly, the thermostats support two radios, so I think you can add ZigBee, Z-Wave or Insteon home automation modules.

title: Decent app
text:
Took forever to connect to WiFi Network. Once unit got connected, programming was straight and fairly easy. However, certain things are not accessible through the app and should be:

1. Temperature display units (F or C): you can select in your profile whether you want F or C, but you still have to change it manually on the thermostat.
2. No option in the app to set date/time. Still have to do this on thermostat.
3. No option to change operation mode from Single Stage to Dual Stage (Fast or Slow recovery) from the app.
4. 3M advertises this unit as a true "auto change" thermostat, meaning it switches from Heat to Cool to Heat automatically. That implies that you can just set your Target Temperatures (i.e. 70F at home, 76F away,  74F Night for AC, 68F Night for Heat) and the unit will simply maintain these regardless what mode it's in.
5. Should have some control over recovery rate.

Still, once connected to WiFi, it's easy to operate and the Auto mode is a blessing in the Spring and Fall, when temperatures change drastically daily.

Had son come to house found bad thermocouple in furnace, if we had not had this stat we would have had frozen pipes, as the temp that night was to be in low 20's. Thanks for a GREAT product, wish it could notify me if temp went below set point!

title: Bulletproof!
text: One of the most useful apps I have.  We turn up the temperature when we leave for the cabin and we're toasty warm when we arrive.  The whole family loves it!  I can also check on the temperature settings from home after guests leave to make sure we're not burning propane for an empty cabin.  I've never had any problems with the app.  It does exactly what I want it to do.

title: Outstanding!
text: Outstanding app! Highly recommended! And keeps Improving. Love the new Radius feature. However, I would recommend an option where you can schedule when Radius is active (ie, I'd like it to be turned off on weekends when we're coming and going and when my son who doesn't have a smartphone gets home from school). title: Workaround to solve crash
text:
It crashes on launch. To fix , you don't need to uninstall.

1) Turn off wifi and data in settings.

2) Launch thermostat and it will pop-up a retry button.

3) close and re-enable wifi. This is faster of jailbroken because you can double-tap home and click anything (just so you can launch sbsetting and turn in wifi while thermostat running in background).

4) double-tap home and bring up thermostat. After you've re-enabled wifi, click retry and it should work. Worked for me and now it Doesn't crash. But I was jailbroken so I was able to re-enable wifi with sbsettings and go back to thermostat and retry. But experiment and you should be able to re-launch the app after re-enabling wifi to do the same thing
